html:
Karuna Skin to Launch New Skincare Line at Whole Foods Market

Beauty Meets Wellness, Sustainability and On-Trend Ingredients

Karuna Skin, the female-owned skincare and beauty brand, announced today the launch of their new skincare line available at Whole Foods Market stores across the United States.

This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220217005285/en/

Karuna Skin (Photo: Business Wire)

The Karuna Skin line for Whole Foods Market offers beauty products that act in synergy with the body. The collection combines the four principles of Ayurveda practices, Traditional Chinese Medicine, Adaptogens, and Clinical Science together for effective formulations. All products do not contain parabens, phthalates, formaldehyde, and SLS/SLES.

The brand offers three collections, providing options for varying skin types, created to balance your skin – customers can try the Maintain, Boost, and Correct collection sets. The Maintain line serves as a starting point to restore balance in the skin. Customers can then personalize their skin care routine based on their skin concerns with products from the Boost line, to moisturize, and the Correct line, to visibly brighten.

“My goal with this collection is to bring an efficacious line of skincare that combines the best practices of the East and the West inspired by my own personal skincare journey, and deliver it at an accessible price point,” said Linda Wang, Founder and CEO of Karuna Skin.

“We’re excited to launch Karuna Skin at Whole Foods Market and offer a new skincare line that acts in synergy with your body,” said Kathleen Chiang, Assistant Category Merchant at Whole Foods Market. “Karuna Skin offers on trend formulations that include unique ingredients like black hoof mushroom, snow mushrooms and prickly pear cactus.”

The Karuna Skin for Whole Foods Market line features 11 SKUS with prices ranging from $5 – $23. The collection includes some key and on-trend ingredients like black hoof mushroom, snow mushrooms and prickly pear cactus which are great ingredients to provide a balanced approach to wellness. Shop the collection now at Whole Foods Market stores nationwide and karunaskin.com.

About Karuna Skin

Karuna Skin, based in Culver City, California, was created in 2009 by Founder and CEO Linda Wang. After developing skin issues and spending significant time visiting her family in Taiwan as a child where an eastern doctor made a skin cream for her using Traditional Chinese herbs to treat her eczema, Linda developed a passion for all things skincare. Inspired by techniques she observed in her personal experiences, Linda decided to create a line of paper facial masks, being the first to bring this category to the U.S. market. After many years of great success, Karuna Skin has expanded from sheet masks to cleansers, toners, serums, eye treatments and moisturizers. The brand is committed to make sustainable, honest, innovative products using ingredients accessible to everyone. For more information visit karunaskin.com and follow the brand on Instagram @karunaskin.

View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220217005285/en/

Giovanna Derenzo
